channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023120688
item.description:
Report X-2023120688

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: HALETHORPE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: once noticed that the package was leaking, placed into a hazmat storage container and placed into the damage hazmat cage. DescribePack: one of the gallons had a loose cap. which caused the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately cleaned up with powder to contain the smell that it gave off.

item.title: Report X-2023120731
item.description:
Report X-2023120731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING SORTATION. DescribePack: THE CAP CAME LOOSE AND THE PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT INTERNALLY AND COAT THE OTHER JUGS IN THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2023110039
item.description:
Report I-2023110039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T00:37:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10.4.23 at approximately 7:45am, during a transfer of Ferric Chloride from railcar(PVSX213032) into All-Chem trailer (FRP64) the air valve on the trailer malfunctioned causing a release. The loader immediately climbed down from the railcar and closed both the internal and external valves on the trailer. Approximately 2 gallons of product was released, notifications were made to proper NS, RSI, PVS and All-Chem personnel. Hepaco arrived on site around 12pm, cleaned up, removed all debris and departed around 2:15pm.
